p: A total of 3,744 bees representing 31 genera and 120 species were recorded in this study. Pan traps sampled 2,036 bees, representing 30 different genera and 107 different species (see Table S1 for complete species list). With hand netting, 1,708 bees were sampled, comprising 25 different genera and 72 different species (Table S1). Some of the bee species were only recorded with one of the two sampling methods: Pan trapping sampled 89% of the total of 120 bees, and 48 species (40%) were sampled exclusively. Hand netting sampled 60% of all species seen in this study, 13 species (11%) exclusively.
